text: Buellia abstracta (synonym – Buellia sequaxThe identity of Buellia sequax, Mireia Giralt,Frank Bungartz, John A. Elix, Mycological Progress (Impact Factor: 1.61). 01/2011; 10(1):115-119. DOI: 10.1007/s11557-010-0695-0, ) is a lichen. In California, it is the most commonly occurring member of the Buellia genus, and is common in the Mojave Desert.Buellia abstracta in the Joshua Tree National Park, Kerry Knudsen, Kocourková Jana, ==References== Category:Fungi of North America Category:Teloschistales Category:Fungi described in 1903
title: Buellia abstracta
